solution_line_template: Ginger has {num_children} children whom she bakes for {holidays_per_child} times a year, for {num_children}*{holidays_per_child}= <<{num_children}*{holidays_per_child}={cakes_for_children_per_year}>>{cakes_for_children_per_year} cakes.
She makes her husband {cakes_for_husband_per_year} cakes a year.
She makes each of her {num_parents} parents a cake for {num_parents}*{birthdays_per_parent}=<<{num_parents}*{birthdays_per_parent}={cakes_for_parents_per_year}>>{cakes_for_parents_per_year} cakes.

On a yearly basis, she therefore makes {cakes_for_children_per_year}+{cakes_for_husband_per_year}+{cakes_for_parents_per_year}= <<{cakes_for_children_per_year}+{cakes_for_husband_per_year}+{cakes_for_parents_per_year}={total_cakes_per_year}>>{total_cakes_per_year} cakes.
In {num_years} years, she would make {total_cakes_per_year}*{num_years}=<<{total_cakes_per_year}*{num_years}={total_cakes_in_10_years}>>{total_cakes_in_10_years} cakes.
